posts.content:
The Crafty Divine Archer


This build draft looked interesting:
- Wizard for lvl 6 spells, craft wand, scribe scroll
- Paladin for divine might, divine shield, great saves, fear/disease immunity
- Arcane Archer to boost ranged AB and damage

It borrows some concepts from Grizzled_Dwarflord's Divine Howitzer. 
The AB is lower (but still an good 46) to fit a number of other features into the build.
I drop Cha a little trying to give it more HP and to access the Wizard 6 spells

Wands of interest include invisibility, haste, improved invisibility, shadow conjuration (for darkness), ultravision, see invisibility, lesser spell breach, stoneskin, summon IV, animate dead, Bulls/Eagles/Endurance, prot v elements
Scroll crafting of interest includes Summon V + VI, Bigby's 5 and 6, Greater Spell Breach, Greater Stoneskin, Lesser Spell Mantle, Mass Haste, Lesser Mind Blank, Mestil's, Tensor's

Damage with the longbow: 1d8 +13 enchant arrow +10-16 divine +2-8 mighty +arrow damage 19-20/x3 = 26 to 45 plus arrow damage

Addition:
This is a Red Mage Version with both Cleric and Wizard spells.
Scrolls and wands up to cleric 4 / wizard 4 can be made.
It has animal domain so Summon V is used instead of Summon IV on the wands, plus there are dual spellbooks for twice as many spells (more than twice as many, as clerics get more spells/day). Animal domain also gets true seeing at level 3 as a cleric domain spell, which is normally a level 5+ spell. 
Second domain could be anything, I think the strongest would be strength domain (for extra divine power / day) or healing (empowered cures on your summons)
It still has an AB of 45 plus the same divine arrow damage, up to 6 attacks / round with haste and rapid shot.
HP is lower to boost wisdom and saves are lower without paladin.

Addition 2:
Started playtesting the red mage (dual cleric - wizard up to lvl 4 spells) version which I liked better of the two. Its very nice in environments where buffs can be applied to ranged weapons and arrows (ie WoG), such as flame weapon. There was plenty of AB early on, so I took more wizard levels over cleric at the beginning (for faster invisibility), but kept the lvl 2 cleric 1 to access animal domain for empowered summons. Have also added a skill schedule for the red mage version. Keen senses + wisdom score + spot is pretty nice for detecting enemies from a distance. Very easy to play and very easy to level.
